dct_description_sm: Alternate title: Rokko. In upper left margin: Formosa city plans 1:6,000. Polyconic projection. Relief shown by spot elevations. Compiled from aerial photgraphy dated November 1943, by photo-planimetric method, and by reference to Formosa 1:25,000, A.M.S. Sheet 2119-II SE., 1944; Formosa 1:50,000, Second Edition A.M.S. 2, Sheet 2119-II, 1944; Japanese Imperial Land Survey 1:50,000, Rokko, 1927. Additional information from intelligence data. Place names are transcribed according to the modified Hepburn (Romaji) System. With a glossary. Name has been changed to Hsi-chuang [Hsichuang]. Relief shown by spot elevations. Heights in meters. Military grid. Three classes of roads or trails, two classes of railroads, and areas of vegetation and cultivation are shown. Includes "Glossary." Marginal maps and diagrams: Index to boundaries.--Coverage diagram. Place names are transcribed according to the modified Hepburn (Romaji) System. AMS 1.
dct_publisher_sm: Washington, D.C. : Army Map Service, U.S. Army, 1944.
